    Brooklyn Express: “69 (Mickey Re-Work)”

    DATE:
    July 24th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    mpFree     REACTIONS: 0

    Get your groove on with Belgium’s producer/DJ Mickey club-ready rework of Brooklyn Express’ “Sixty-Nine”, based around a sample from Jimmy “Bo” Horne’s disco-funk classic “Spank”. Grab a free download of this fine rework below, and keep your eyes peeled for more magic from Mickey with a new EP set to arrive in September on Exploited Records.

    Download here

    Gasback:
    Mickey: “You Know The Beat”

    Studio Paradiso: “Ohana”

    DATE:
    July 24th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Los Angeles producer Michael David, one half of our beloved Classixx , is now flying solo under his new moniker Studio Paradiso. His debut release, a two-track 12” called “Ohana”, will drop next month on the newly formed label Distant Works , which LA’s producer/DJ Daniel.T. (of Cosmic Kids fame) co-runs alongside friend and frequent collaborator Cooper Saver. The EPs title track, a finely crafted smooth jam, finds him in such fine form. What a great start for the label.

    In Studio Paradiso’s own words: “These are two instrumental songs that I’ve been meaning to finish for a little while. ‘Ohana’ is based on a lot of songs that I grew up listening to on 94.7 The Wave, LA’s smooth jazz station. ‘Samurai Dreams’ was a soft-porn that David Cronenberg directed as an insert for Videodrome. I thought it would be fun to score it, and so the song came together as an exercise.

    Studio Paradiso’s “Ohana” 12” will drop in August on Distant Works. Pre-order it here .

    Gasback:
    Museum Of Love: “Who’s Who Of Who Cares” [Daniel.T. & Cooper Saver Remix]

    Ben Browning: “Friends Of Mine (Wild & Free Remix)”

    DATE:
    July 24th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    We’ve already heard and saw the video of Cut Copy’s bassist Ben Browning newest single “Friends Of Mine”, a disco-infused synth pop tune taken from his superb debut solo album “Turns”. Now, we’ve got our hands on a new version of the track from Los Angeles-based duo Wild & Free , who spins the tune into much blissed-out territory with an array of synth melodies and laid-back, sunny grooves. It’s a well-suited remix for a summer drive down the Pacific Coast Highway. Give it a spin above, and ride with us.

    Gasback:
    Ben Browning: “Make It Easy”

    Taragana Pyjarama: “Ber (Round Remix)”

    DATE:
    July 24th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Last time we heard from Copenhagen-based producer Torsten Lindsø Andersen, aka Round , was late last year, when he dropped his solid debut EP “Glass”/”Float” on John Talabot’s critically acclaimed Hivern Discs imprint. Now, he’s back in action, delivering a new remix of “Ber” by fellow Danish producer Taragana Pyjarama . This splendid version of “Ber” is just another reminder that the talented producer knows his way around a remix.

    Taragana Pyjarama’s “Ariel” Remixes EP, which also features reworks by the likes of Olde Gods, Sau Poler, IVVVO, and Kenton Slash Demon, is out now digitally on True Panther.

    Get it here .

    Gasback:
    Round: “Glass”

    Jerry Folk: “Futura”

    DATE:
    July 24th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    mpFree     REACTIONS: 0

    Back in May, Norwegian producer Jerry Folk dropped a superb remix of London’s Oh Wonder “Lose It” that everyone seems to love. Now, the up-and-coming producer returns to our ears with his new original track called “Futura”, a finely crafted tune filled with rich, sun-kissed piano chords, disco-tinged house grooves and a funky bassline. It’s a smooth and highly enjoyable ride. You can now grab a free download of “Futura” below.

    Download here

    Gasback:
    Oh Wonder: “Lose It” [Jerry Folk Remix]

    Róisín Murphy: “Evil Eyes (Hercules & Love Affair Remix)”

    DATE:
    July 23rd, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Irish dance-pop queen Róisín Murphy is set to drop another strong remix package, this time for her recent single “Evil Eyes”, one of the standout cuts from “Hairless Toys”, her first solo album in eight years. The new remix EP includes reworks by the likes of Hercules And Love Affair, Claptone, Catz ‘N Dogz, and Severino & Nico de Segilia. Today, we’re treated to a full stream of Andy Butler’s New York disco-house collective Hercules & Love Affair quality remix of “Evil Eyes”. After getting your fill of the remix above, make sure to check out Róisín Murphy’s self-directed video for “Evil Eyes” here .

    The “Evil Eyes” Remix EP arrives on August 7 on Play It Again. Pre-order it here .

    Gasback:
    Sébastien Tellier: “Aller Vers Le Soleil” [Hercules & Love Affair Remix]

    House Of 909: “So Much Love For You”

    DATE:
    July 22nd, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Originally released all the way back in 1997, London’s trio House Of 909 classic album “The Children We Were”, an eight-track record of effortlessly smooth, midtempo house groovers, was embraced by a niche audience, but overlooked on a larger scale. Now, a full 18 years later, New York/London-based label Cascine reissues “The Children We Were” on limited-edition vinyl, as well as in digital form. The material has been remastered, the artwork redone and the record repackaged. One of the album’s finest moments is “So Much Love For You”, featuring vocals from Bobbi Depasois, an elegant piece of house brilliance. What’s not to love?

    House Of 909’s album “The Children We Were” drops on August 7 on Cascine.
    You can pre-order your copy here .

    Unknown: “Aguirre (Tempel Rytmik Edit)”

    DATE:
    July 22nd, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Let your ears feast on this quality edit called “Aguirre” from Spanish maestro John Talabot and Genius Of Time’s Alexander Berg, aka Dorisburg , as Tempel Rytmik. Taken from the third installment of Hivern Discs’ vinyl-only edit series”HivernEd” of obscure tracks. It also features “Zulu”, another technoish edit from John Talabot and fellow Barcelona producer Marc Piñol, on the flip.

    The “Aguirre”/”Zulu” 10” is out now on Hivern Discs. Pick up your copy here .

    Gasback:
    Ishinohana: “Lucia” [John Talabot’s Sunset edit]

    De Lux: “Oh Man The Future” Video

    DATE:
    July 21st, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Take a ride through the streets of Long Beach with De Lux , the Los Angeles-based Sean Guerin and Isaac Franco, in their new video for “Oh Man The Future”, one of the standout cuts from their sophomore album “Generation”, out now on Innovative Leisure. Get it here .

    Directed by Eric Coleman.

    Gasback:
    De Lux: “Someday Now”

    Jax Jones: “Yeah Yeah Yeah (Roosevelt Remix)”

    DATE:
    July 21st, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Yeah, it’s Roosevelt time once again. After dropping a superb remix of Sundara Karma’s “Flame” just last week, Cologne-based singer/producer and Greco-Roman affiliate Marius Lauber has turned his hand to “Yeah Yeah Yeah”, the newest single from UK producer and songwriter Jax Jones . In true Roosevelt fashion, the dancefloor-ready original track, full of soulful vibes and vintage disco strings, is stretched out to seven minutes with shimmering synths and a groovy bassline. Good vibes all around!

    The “Yeah Yeah Yeah” remix package, which also includes reworks by Got Some, Mak & Pasteman, Set Mo, and Mike Millrain, plus dub versions from Jax himself, drops on July 24th via Jax Trax/Polydor. You can pre-order the single here .

    Gasback:
    Jax Jones: “Luv Like This”
